article: Alone in the light at the dining room table, surrounded by a nearly dark house, I sat in tears. Finally, I _ in getting both kids to bed. As a new single _ , I had to be both Mommy and Daddy to my two little children. With full rights of my children, I _ to give them a normal and comfortable home life. I put on a happy face for them. I rose slowly, trying not to _ even the least sound which might start them up _ . I tiptoed out of their room, _ the door part way, and went downstairs. And loneliness . I _ as thought I were at the bottom of a great sea of loneliness. It all _ together and I was at once lost. I sat there, _ crying. Just then, a pair of little _ went around my middle and a little face looked up at me. I looked down into my five-year-old son's _ face. I was shy to be _ crying by my son. "I'm sorry. Ethan, I didn't know you were still awake." I don't know why, but so many people _ when they cry and I was no exception. "I didn't _ to cry. I'm just a little _ tonight." "It's ok, Daddy. It's okay to cry; you're just a person ." I couldn't express how happy he made me, this little boy, who was simple, gave me _ to cry. He seemed to be saying that I didn't have to always be _ , and that sometimes it was possible to allow myself to feel weak and let out my _ .
